channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Maurene Comey, Prosecutor Fired by Trump, Calls Fear the ‘Tool of the Tyrant’
item.description: Maurene Comey, who helped prosecute Jeffrey Epstein and Sean Combs, was dismissed without a detailed explanation. She is the daughter of James B. Come...

item.title: Jamie Dimon turned down Jeff Bezos and a top gig at Amazon to take on ‘troubled’ Bank One in a $60 million bet
item.description: Dimon told the "Acquired" podcast that the version of his life where he moved to Seattle to work at Amazon is an "alternate universe."

item.title: Slack’s paid users are getting new time-saving AI tools
item.description: Tools are meant to improve productivity.

item.title: Virtuos helped make one of the year’s best-selling video games. Now, 300 of its workers may be out of a job
item.description: The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered became the third-best-selling video game of 2025 in less than a week.

item.title: Ron Wyden, a Democrat, Won’t Let Go of the Jeffrey Epstein Case, Either
item.description: Senator Ron Wyden has found that four banks waited until Mr. Epstein’s arrest on federal charges to flag $1.5 billion in suspicious transactions. Mr. ...

item.title: Trump’s Attacks on Powell and the Fed Ripple Through Global Economy
item.description: The independence of central banks, which allows policymakers to operate free from political meddling, is considered sacrosanct by investors and econom...

item.title: As AI comes for entry-level gigs, Whole Foods exec says the $13.7 billion grocer is reviving artisans with butcher, cheese, and bakery apprenticeships
item.description: About 1,300 Whole Foods employees have been upskilled in an artisan craft from fishmongering to cake decorating, offering unemployed Gen Z an alternat...

item.title: Trump’s Coca Cola post tanked share prices for high fructose corn syrup makers
item.description: Shares for Archer-Daniels-Midland and Ingredion both fell at least 6% in after hours trading.

item.title: Israeli Strike on a Gaza Church Kills Three
item.description: As cease-fire talks stalled, a deadly strike on a Catholic church in Gaza City prompted Pope Leo XIV to call for an immediate end to the fighting.

item.title: Connie Francis, ‘Pretty Little Baby’ and ‘Who’s Sorry Now’ Singer, Dies at 87
item.description: Ms. Francis, who had a natural way with a wide variety of material, ruled the charts with songs like “Who’s Sorry Now” and “Where the Boys Are.”

item.title: Iraq Shopping Mall Fire Kills at Least 61
item.description: Local officials blamed shoddy construction and a lack of preparedness for the scale of the tragedy at the newly opened building.

item.title: They Grew Up on Mexican Coke. Trump’s Cane Sugar Plan Makes Them Uneasy.
item.description: After President Trump announced that Coke will be made with cane sugar in the U.S., as it is in Mexico, foodies of Mexican heritage said in interviews...

item.title: Shopping Mall Fire Kills at Least 61 in Iraq
item.description: Local officials said that the scale of the tragedy was worsened by shoddy construction and a lack of preparedness.

item.title: Israeli Strike on a Gaza Church Kills Three
item.description: As cease-fire talks stalled, a deadly strike on a Catholic church in Gaza City prompted Pope Leo XIV to call for an immediate end to the fighting.

item.title: Syria’s President Condemns Israeli Strikes on Damascus
item.description: President Ahmed al-Shara said the airstrike on Damascus threatened to escalate sectarian violence, in his sharpest criticism of Israel since he came t...
